October 25, 1952
Hr* Earl Wynn
University of North Carolina
Chapel Hill, North Carolina
Dear Earls
I have been authorized by the committee appointed to
select an Executive Director to offer you the job of
Executive Director of the National Association of Educa¬
tional Broadcasters at a salary of ten thousand dollars
a year effective January 1, 1953 9 and continuing on an
annual renegotiable basis for a period of four years*
This offer is subject to ratification by the Board of
Directors of this association! however, I have discussed
the matter with the majority of the members of the Board
and have had their informal endorsement of this offer*
After a very lengthy and thorough search, this
committee is of the un&ninous opinion that you are
the man we want and need for this job and I sincerely
hope that you will see your way clear to accept the
offer* Xou have discussed details of this position
with me and other members of the organization in con¬
siderable detail on a number of occasions, so I do not
feel that it is necessary to go into fir ther explanation
or elaboration concerning the job at this time* If there
are further questions or if there is need for additional
discussion, there will be an opportunity for this at the
meeting in Minneapolis the first week in November. We
should like, however, to have a definite decision from
you at the Minneapolis convention*
I should like to repeat that it is ay sincere hope
that you will accept this offer and that we may look
forward to four years of work with you as our xecutive
Director#
Most sincerely yours.
Graydon Anemias, Directcr
Radio Broadcasting Services
Manager, WUOA(FM)
